title: Good Practice Case of Romania: e‐Health and Interoperability ‐ Healthcare Provider Perspective
segmentation: I would like to kindly invite Mr. Dursley Skate 2.
Give us a presentation.
We will be discussing the health care provider perspective of interoperability.
And you said the streets keys coming from a company called Info World in Romania is got a Bachelor degree in economics and a Masters degree in Business Administration.
And he's responsible for.
Lots of things in the company.
Managing monitoring the national international software projects.
Coordination of international you projects and so on.
Music that risky.
So I already.
My colleague already introduced me.
I'll speak about interoperability from the perspective of health care providers.
As you know I'm working for info and I just want to tell you a few things about my company.
We have about 10 years experience just in medical software 200 employees.
We are part of Rachel 7 organization.
And we participate with the software development to IHE Connectone.
About that today agenda.
To discuss the case study.
Related to.
A chain of medical clinics from Romania.
The interoperability from a non technical perspective, becausw.
Plus, you know interoperability is not just technical things.
The solution that we create in order to resolve the interoperability issues and this solution means also architecture and design.
The tools that we use.
How the change management process is run according to the interoperability changed?
And at the end, because I'm the last one in the session, will have the discussions.
So both Med center Med Center is a chain of clinics.
They have certain clinics, 8 laboratories.
They are doing the laboratory work for and.
Radiology exams for other five hospitals.
They have about 500 users.
They are exchanging about more than 500,000 documents per month.
And they have about 50,000 encounters per month, means meetings between patients and the patients and the.
Yeah doctors.
These are the some pictures about the clinics.
And I'll try to introduce few theoretical issues.
That are working currently in the Romanian environment, so there are but not in the Romanian environment everywhere.
We have some infrastructure parts with the.
Which contains a lot of tools, database, engine, messaging, workflow, business rule engines we have apart with registries which means vocabulary.
Registry for medical personnel, health care organization, and so on.
Operational services like.
The.
Hospital information system.
Laboratory application for pairs.
And therefore regulators and also decision support systems which to be honest are not very developed currently in the Romanian environment.
Regarding interoperability levels.
We split the interoperability in syntactic, which means data structure and transport and semantic, which means vocabularies the identities and business rules.
Regarding the requirements that we.
Implement through the solutions that we create.
The requirements are quite standard.
In any country, so we need to keep the existing assets to support customized system and commercial of the shelf.
To support an incremental adoption.
Because we will not be able to implement everything in the same time.
To have a secure system and to support multiple.
Programming languages and different topologies.
This is a very important slide becausw.
I put in this list.
What?
What are the requirements for the an electronic service and an electronic service means also interoperability, so we need to know what are the operations that we can we we need to perform what?
What are the exchange data structure?
What are the exceptions that we're going to get from the services?
How are we going to transport the messages through web services to email or whatever?
What is the physical address of an electronic service?
What about security?
How are we doing with the authentication and authorization?
What is the meaning of the data?
The semantical issues.
What are the business rules that I should respect as let's say client for an electronic service?
And if these rules are going to be formalized in a language, or just, you know, narrative way, how can I access the vocabularies?
How can I access the entities?
For instance, the patients MI?
Do I have the possibility to interrogate the Master National Master Patient Index?
If I have a testing environment because for part of electronic services we don't have testing environment and this is a big issue.
And if I have simulation features in electronic claiming for instance pre authorization for.
For claims
And I put here few success criteria which came from the customer side.
Have a friendly user interface, they don't care too much about interoperability because they suppose that interoperability is also he is already there.
So they are caring more about friendly user interface electronic claiming it means not interoperability, how they're going to receive the money.
They don't like to to work with papers.
They want to have an integrated integrated system with all the all the partners.
To have a transparent clinical data reporting.
To have.
The very rapid development for new medical sheets and to have the possibility to modify the medical vocabulary is on the fly.

The solution that info creates for Med center was a solution based on HL 7 version three, CDA, version 2, zero, so all the messages that are exchanged between between Med center and Med Center partners are recording with CDA version 2.
How the Deployement architecture looks like?
We Med center is keeping all the data in the hosting center provided by National Telecom Company.
They have implemented the hospital Information System, Laboratory information system parks, and the radiology information system and application for inventory.
An application for reporting and here I mean KPI's, public health reporting.
And maybe Pedia Media is a personal health report.
Usually is used just to exchange the lab result in order to short the time between.
Specimen collection and receiving of the lab result is also a way to empower the patient as.
You already know.
So regarding the deployment architecture, all the hospitals are connected to to the hosting center and with the hosted services in the hosting center.
But you gotta think the architectural emphasize just the main important components.
We have a registry and repository for documents.
We have special service for.
For vocabulary.
They go a little bit in detail.
After that the service for entities in order to to manage the patient, but just not the patients.
Also, the organizations, the payer, the business partners.
And also the rules.
Security Service switches claim based security.
All this service to to manage all the events in the system.
And to have also blogging.
And the data warehouse, which is the basis for KPI's and public health reporting.
This is.
Another view of the same architecture we have.
The web services we have the USB's and we have the client applications on the top.
What security services in charge with?
He's in charge with confidentiality, integrity, authentication, authorization, so very basic things for any any applications.
The good part is that is a claim based security.
All the roles are stored in LDAP.
The policies are recording with.
Raise the standard and very important feature for quite big organization is record level authorization.
They have the possibility to have rights according to organization or to the area that they are working in.
The vocabulary service is a key service regarding semantic interoperability.
We are currently importing the codes from central authorities.
We have the possibility to browse and edit in order to add the new coding systems and all the codes are published to do the.
The client applications through web services.
The service was created according to HL 7 common terminology services.
And the most important features are on the top of the slide, so we have the possibility to create coding systems.
We have the possibility to create value sets be cause for instance, for cardiology we are not going to use the full ICD 10 and we have also the possibility to create mapping becausw.
Very often the data entry is done in one coding standard, but the reporting is.
Done in another coding standard, so we we need to do some mapping.
Another
Key key service, which is a very simple service but it is important for the organization is the identity management.
Maybe the name is not according to the expectations to your expectations what.
What is it about all the documents that are created in an organization should have a counter and usually the counters are according to the to the customer policy.
So we create the special service that can create numbers or not necessary numbers according to the customer.
Or if you dare leave, changing the name of medical record in every year according to the world that they are working on and so on.
So the service is answering two context to the application context.
With Nature 7 I I data type.
Another service is Entity Identification Services, also created according to H. L7 Entity identification service.
And is in charge with managing patients, persons, devices, organization referrals, doctors, companies and so on.
So any entity which is inside of the Messenger application is.
Maintained by this service.
The next one is record location and update service.
It contains 2 main components.
One is registry and repository, the other one is repository.
The service was tested in Conecta, Tony and is according with IHE profiles XDS A&E CSB.
This is not necessary service, but.
It's a publish subscribe feature for any for any service, so all the services that I was talking about contains this possibility to subscribe to and you will receive notification.
But not the services query for existing data.
This is also an IHE profile we didn't test it yet to connect at on, but is also part of the European project.
It aggregates basically the data from multiple source.
This is not a service.
This is a tool which responds to to customer needs in order in order to do very easily the change request because the change requests are coming all the time.
Usually the hospitals and the clinics are not able to create the standard sheets and to keep it forever.
And I can understand that, but we need to have a way to implement very easily the the.
May
Nickel sheets this is according to HL 7 CDA, so the output of the of the tool.
It will be an HL 7.
Deviate the features.
One of the requested features, which was to have multiple printing formats so they have the same date data entry sheet, but they want to print it in different way.
It is according to HL 7 templates, so the constraint languages that we are using is HL 7 templates and very good for us.
HL 7 templates has the support for eight year archetype definition language, which was the constraint language of.
Previews version of this tool.
But the data structure is CDA.
The semantic reasoning is created through HL 7 templates.
If you don't know, I'll tell you a few things about CDA.
CDA contains 2.
Two parts, one is the narrative parts which can be rendered on the screen and the other part is normal data structure.
HL seven data structure.
So the tool came also with a narrative designer, so the the implementer, not the user, can create.
With the designer narrative way of rendering the information it came so also with the report designer Becausw.
The narrative is just.
Let's say machine platform independent.
It will be rendered within XLT.
Also, we have a form designer, data entry designer and the ontology binding are implemented also through H7 template.
So we have the possibility with this.
The language the standard two to do the binding between vocabularies, taxonomies, ontologies and the data structure, which is a very important thing.
OK, the change management to change management.
Is quite simple.
We are updating the CDA implementation guide and after that the technical person will create the templates testing and that's it.
Regarding electronic, claiming we have a quite extensive experience, we used to work on different markets.
What we are doing in the in Romania we are working with an electronic service provided by National Insurance House.
And we are doing also the DRG reporting.
This is basically the flow for batch insurance claiming claiming in Romania there is no online claiming you the claiming is just batch claiming and the workflow is like that we are keeping.
We're collecting the data in the warehouse.
We are doing the semantic conversion we are.
Convert the vocabularies from the data entry vocabularies to the reporting vocabulary.
Also the syntactic conversion, which means that we're changing the data structure.
We are applying the business rules that we get from the National Insurance House and the tip at the end will be a payload for a web service or a file that will be sent.
Bye.
DVD The Change management challenge.
Came usually from the semantic conversion becauses there is not.
The vocabulary and national vocabulary service, so from time to time we receive changed in the vocabularies without specifying exactly what's going on, and we need to do the mapping again.
The syntactic conversion is not so difficult.
The tools and technologies we are using.
Microsoft tools.
Soserver.netframeworkwindowsformasp.net and we have also a Silverlight application, which is the last version of our application.
The standards that we are using HL 7 services HL 7 version 3HL7 CDA IHE profiles DICOM and vocabulary is national vocabularies ICD 10 Lawing and so.
That's it, thank you very much.
